00018 {
00019 public:
00020     PIDController(std::string name, float Kp, float Ki, float Kd, float period, float outputlowerlimit, float outputupperlimit);
00021     ~PIDController();

00023     float doControl(float input);
00024     void setTarget(float target);
00025     
00026     void clearState();
00027     
00028 private:
00029     std::string name;                           // The name of the controller (used to idenitify it amoung ther controllers)
00030     
00031     // PID Controller constants
00032     float Kp, Ki, Kd;                 // The proportional, integral and derivative gains
00033     float period;                               // The period of the control loop
00034     float outputupperlimit, outputlowerlimit;   // The upper and lower limits of the controller output    
00035     float d_constant, a_constant;               // The derivative filter constant, and the anti-windup filter constant
00036     
00037     // PID Controller variables
00038     float target;                               // The current set point
00039     float error, previouserror;                 // The error between the set point and the actual value
00040     float proportional, previousproportional;   // The proportional term
00041     double integral, previousintegral;          // The integral term
00042     float derivative, previousderivative;       // The derivative term
00043     
00044     float limitOutput(float unlimitedoutput);   // Clip the controller output to the actuator limits
00045     
00046 #if PIDCONTROLLER_DEBUG > 0
00047     ofstream pidLog;
00048 #endif
